response.content:
Hi Warren,

Thanks for your review.
Just checked your progress and found that it's just 5%. Watching 3-4 lectures is not really enough to evaluate the entire course.
In "Setup" video lecture, we have provided commonly used VS code packages, which will help you to write code in much simpler way. If you have any trouble in understanding how those packages work and If that's the main reason of your lower rating, than feel free to reach out and post your questions regarding that, we will help you.

Best
response.content_html:
Hi Warren,

Thanks for your review.
Just checked your progress and found that it's just 5%. Watching 3-4 lectures is not really enough to evaluate the entire course.

If you have any trouble in understanding how those packages work and If that's the main reason of your lower rating, than feel free to reach out and post your questions regarding that, we will help you.

results.content: The first three sections of this course were boring, and I struggled to get through it. But once I got to section four, it started to make a lot more sense and be more fun. Overall, this course has been fantastic. I've learned how to make search bars, buttons, form fields, "cards" that contain information, pop-up boxes ("modals"), progress charts, clickable tooltips, and more. I took this course because I wanted to learn how to make user interfaces for decentralized webapps. And, it has taught me exactly what I needed to know. So I can't complain.

results.content:
I've gone through many bootstrap tutorials but it had always been a perplexing stuff for me until I came across this tutorial. It's a perfect content for those who have a slight knowledge of js, css, and html. Real work applications and the simplicity with which the trainer explains things makes it so much fun and engaging and the best part is that you get to learn by making layouts which can easily be used for real-world applications. I always dreamt of making a website by myself and this course definitely takes me closer towards achieving it.

Kudos to the trainers for brilliant work and being very responsive to questions.

results.content:
It was really good the way he explained things. It's like a hands-on thing- i.e. 'you learn while making projects' and, that's the real way to learn as you will have a slick portfolio alongside the completion of the course, you always have a chance to improve the project late on by putting on some extra features in your projects.

I will also mention that you should watch the videos first and then repeat them to code along. That works the best! Only coding along? You are missing stuff man!

results.content:
Really good learning experience. The instructor was able to communicate the things well. I was able to complete all 4 projects and grab the basic to advance concepts of Bootstrap4, HTML, CSS and jQuery. I would recommend this course to web designers and developers who have basic knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3. This course would help you to develop basic to advance level understanding of how Bootstrap framework works and above all, the 4 projects would help you to polish your skills more as it did for me.
Special Thanks to Lasha Nozadze, George Lomidze and Code & Create for this great course.
Regards,
Ahsan Ali

results.content: This course goes over a pretty in depth analysis of Bootstrap with some CSS and jQuery. It's a great course and I would encourage you to get it. The only thing I would say is that the instructor has a pretty thick accent which is hard to understand at first but you get used to it AND he doesn't go into the "why" of how things work a ton. But, I wouldn't let that hold you back from getting it. It's great.
